wikipedia_page.main: Christopher George Vacher (born 3 December 1951) is a British television presenter, best known as a long-serving main anchor of BBC West's flagship regional news programme Points West for 28 years.

link_mentions.page: List of former BBC newsreaders and journalists
response: * Chris Vacher – main anchor on the BBC's Points West from 1983 until his retirement in 2011. He previously held the record as the longest–serving presenter on any British local news programme: however, this record has since been beaten by the former main anchor on Look East, Stewart White, who presented the latter programme from 1984 until 2021.

In 1984, he became the lead presenter on Look East, where he remained until his sudden departure in September 2021. He became the longest-serving BBC regional news presenter in the UK following Chris Vacher's retirement in 2011.
